A '''flow jam''' (also '''spin jam''' or '''jam''') is an informal gathering where [[flow arts]] practitioners meet to practice, share techniques, and socialize. Flow jams are a primary community-building activity in the flow arts world.

== Format ==

Flow jams vary in size from a handful of spinners in a park to organized events with dozens of participants. Common elements include:

* '''Open practice space''': Participants bring their own props and practice freely
* '''Skill sharing''': More experienced spinners teach techniques to others
* '''Music''': Often provided by speakers or live musicians
* '''Community atmosphere''': Emphasis on inclusivity and mutual support

== Types ==

* '''Daytime jams''': Held in parks or open spaces, using practice props
* '''Night jams''': After dark, using [[LED props]] or [[fire spinning|fire props]]
* '''Fire jams''': Specifically focused on fire performance, requiring a designated safety person, fire blanket, and appropriate venue
* '''Festival jams''': Large-scale jams at flow arts festivals or music festivals

== Locations ==

Flow jams occur worldwide. Many cities have regular weekly or monthly jams organized through social media groups or local flow arts communities. Some parks and public spaces become known as regular jam spots.
